back_cards.definition_en: To change or shift from one option to another.
back_cards.example_en: I decided to switch my phone plan to a cheaper one.

back_cards.definition_en: To turn on or off an electrical device.
back_cards.example_en: Please switch off the lights before leaving the room.

back_cards.definition_en: To exchange or swap something with another.
back_cards.example_en: We switched seats so she could see the stage better.

back_cards.definition_en: To redirect a train to a different track.
back_cards.example_en: The conductor will switch the train to the express track.

back_cards.definition_en: To change focus or topic in a conversation.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s switch to discussing our plans for the weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: A person from Iraq.
back_cards.example_en: The Iraqi shared stories about his hometown in Baghdad.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the culture or people of Iraq.
back_cards.example_en: She cooked an Iraqi dish with fragrant spices.

back_cards.definition_en: A citizen of Iraq in a formal context.
back_cards.example_en: The Iraqi applied for a visa to study abroad.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to someone involved in Iraqi politics or history.
back_cards.example_en: The Iraqi led the discussion on regional peace.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of Iraq’s diverse communities.
back_cards.example_en: The Iraqi celebrated the festival with traditional music.

back_cards.definition_en: A strong, hard metal used in construction or tools.
back_cards.example_en: The bridge was built with iron beams for durability.

back_cards.definition_en: A device used to press clothes.
back_cards.example_en: She used the iron to smooth out her wrinkled shirt.

back_cards.definition_en: A material symbolizing strength or resilience.
back_cards.example_en: His iron will helped him overcome many challenges.

back_cards.definition_en: A component in food or nutrition, essential for health.
back_cards.example_en: Spinach is rich in iron, good for your blood.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool or weapon in historical contexts.
back_cards.example_en: The blacksmith forged an iron sword for the knight.

back_cards.definition_en: To become aware of something through the senses.
back_cards.example_en: She could perceive a faint smell of flowers in the air.

back_cards.definition_en: To understand or interpret something in a certain way.
back_cards.example_en: He perceived the comment as a subtle insult.

back_cards.definition_en: To notice something through careful observation.
back_cards.example_en: The scientist perceived a pattern in the data.

back_cards.definition_en: To recognize or identify something visually.
back_cards.example_en: I could barely perceive the ship on the horizon.

back_cards.definition_en: To sense a mood or atmosphere in a situation.
back_cards.example_en: She perceived tension in the room during the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Basic or essential to something’s core.
back_cards.example_en: Learning to read is fundamental to education.

back_cards.definition_en: Central to a system or process.
back_cards.example_en: Honesty is a fundamental principle in our company.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the foundation of a subject.
back_cards.example_en: She studied fundamental physics in college.

back_cards.definition_en: Critically important to success or function.
back_cards.example_en: Regular exercise is fundamental to good health.

back_cards.definition_en: Underlying or forming the basis of an idea.
back_cards.example_en: Freedom is a fundamental value in democracy.

back_cards.definition_en: A small group of words expressing an idea.
back_cards.example_en: She learned the phrase ‘thank you’ in Spanish.

back_cards.definition_en: A common expression or saying.
back_cards.example_en: ‘Break a leg’ is a phrase used to wish good luck.

back_cards.definition_en: A segment of speech or writing.
back_cards.example_en: The teacher explained the phrase in the poem.

back_cards.definition_en: A musical sequence in a composition.
back_cards.example_en: The violinist played a beautiful phrase in the symphony.

back_cards.definition_en: A term used in a specific context or field.
back_cards.example_en: The legal phrase was hard to understand without a lawyer.

back_cards.definition_en: A belief taken as true without proof.
back_cards.example_en: His assumption that she was free led to a misunderstanding.

back_cards.definition_en: An idea underlying an argument or decision.
back_cards.example_en: The plan was based on the assumption of good weather.

back_cards.definition_en: A guess made in everyday conversation.
back_cards.example_en: I made the assumption he’d arrive by noon.

back_cards.definition_en: A premise in academic or scientific work.
back_cards.example_en: The study’s assumption was that prices would rise.

back_cards.definition_en: Taking on a role or responsibility.
back_cards.example_en: Her assumption of leadership improved the team.

back_cards.definition_en: Fine grains of rock found on beaches or deserts.
back_cards.example_en: The kids built a castle with sand on the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: Material used in construction or landscaping.
back_cards.example_en: The truck delivered sand for the new garden path.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of time in an hourglass.
back_cards.example_en: The sand in the hourglass marked the end of the game.

back_cards.definition_en: Loose soil in natural environments.
back_cards.example_en: The camel trudged through the hot desert sand.

back_cards.definition_en: A texture used in art or crafts.
back_cards.example_en: She created a sand painting with vibrant colors.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who creates plans for clothing or accessories.
back_cards.example_en: The designer showcased a new dress collection.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who plans the look of products or spaces.
back_cards.example_en: The designer arranged the furniture for the office.

back_cards.definition_en: A creator of visual or digital content.
back_cards.example_en: The website’s designer chose a sleek, modern look.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional in architecture or engineering.
back_cards.example_en: The bridge designer ensured safety and style.

back_cards.definition_en: An artist crafting unique experiences.
back_cards.example_en: The game designer built an immersive virtual world.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of making arrangements for an event.
back_cards.example_en: Wedding planning took months of careful work.

back_cards.definition_en: Organizing tasks for a project or goal.
back_cards.example_en: The team’s planning ensured the project’s success.

back_cards.definition_en: Urban or city development strategies.
back_cards.example_en: City planning improved traffic flow downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: Creating a schedule for personal tasks.
back_cards.example_en: Her planning helped balance work and study.

back_cards.definition_en: Strategic preparation in a business context.
back_cards.example_en: Financial planning secured the company’s future.

back_cards.definition_en: Most important or prominent in a field.
back_cards.example_en: She is a leading expert in marine biology.

back_cards.definition_en: Guiding or directing a group or effort.
back_cards.example_en: The leading candidate inspired the team.

back_cards.definition_en: At the forefront of a competition or race.
back_cards.example_en: The leading runner crossed the finish line first.

back_cards.definition_en: Primary or top in a specific context.
back_cards.example_en: The company is a leading producer of solar panels.

back_cards.definition_en: Influential in shaping trends or ideas.
back_cards.example_en: His leading role in fashion set new styles.

back_cards.definition_en: A way or manner of doing something.
back_cards.example_en: She switched her phone to silent mode during the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: A setting or function in technology.
back_cards.example_en: The camera’s night mode captured clear photos.

back_cards.definition_en: A style or trend, especially in fashion.
back_cards.example_en: Bright colors were the mode this season.

back_cards.definition_en: A type of operation in a system.
back_cards.example_en: The game has a multiplayer mode for friends.

back_cards.definition_en: A statistical term for the most frequent value.
back_cards.example_en: The mode of the data set was 25.

back_cards.definition_en: To a large extent or over a wide area.
back_cards.example_en: Her book was widely read across the country.

back_cards.definition_en: In many different places or by many people.
back_cards.example_en: The app is widely used by students.

back_cards.definition_en: Covering a broad range of opinions or topics.
back_cards.example_en: They discussed the issue widely at the conference.

back_cards.definition_en: Far apart or spread out physically.
back_cards.example_en: The trees were widely spaced in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Commonly accepted or recognized.
back_cards.example_en: He is widely regarded as a talented chef.

back_cards.definition_en: A particular event or celebration.
back_cards.example_en: Her birthday was a joyous occasion for the family.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific time when something happens.
back_cards.example_en: He spoke up on the occasion of the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: A reason or cause for doing something.
back_cards.example_en: The sale gave her an occasion to buy new shoes.

back_cards.definition_en: A special moment marked by an activity.
back_cards.example_en: The festival was an occasion for dancing.

back_cards.definition_en: A rare or notable instance.
back_cards.example_en: On one occasion, we saw a shooting star.

back_cards.definition_en: To present or create, as in a problem or question.
back_cards.example_en: The puzzle posed a challenge for the students.

back_cards.definition_en: To position oneself for a photo or artwork.
back_cards.example_en: She posed for a portrait in the studio.

back_cards.definition_en: To act or pretend in a certain way.
back_cards.example_en: He posed as a doctor to gain trust.

back_cards.definition_en: To raise or introduce a topic for discussion.
back_cards.example_en: The teacher posed a question about history.

back_cards.definition_en: To place or arrange something carefully.
back_cards.example_en: The artist posed the flowers for the still life.

back_cards.definition_en: Close to an exact amount, but not precise.
back_cards.example_en: The trip took approximately two hours.

back_cards.definition_en: Roughly or about, in terms of quantity.
back_cards.example_en: There were approximately 50 people at the event.

back_cards.definition_en: Nearly accurate in measurements.
back_cards.example_en: The room is approximately 10 feet wide.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to estimate time or duration.
back_cards.example_en: We’ll arrive approximately at noon.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating a general range or figure.
back_cards.example_en: The cost is approximately $100 per ticket.

back_cards.definition_en: To stop working, usually after reaching a certain age.
back_cards.example_en: She plans to retire after 30 years of teaching.

back_cards.definition_en: To withdraw or go to bed for the night.
back_cards.example_en: He retired early to rest for the big day.

back_cards.definition_en: To leave a place or activity permanently.
back_cards.example_en: The athlete retired from soccer after an injury.

back_cards.definition_en: To remove something from use.
back_cards.example_en: The company retired the old software system.

back_cards.definition_en: To retreat or step back from a situation.
back_cards.example_en: They retired to the lounge to discuss privately.

back_cards.definition_en: In or to another place.
back_cards.example_en: If it’s sold out here, try looking elsewhere.

back_cards.definition_en: Somewhere different from the current location.
back_cards.example_en: She found better prices elsewhere online.

back_cards.definition_en: In a different context or situation.
back_cards.example_en: His talents were appreciated elsewhere in the industry.

back_cards.definition_en: Away from the main topic or focus.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s move the discussion elsewhere for now.

back_cards.definition_en: In another country or region.
back_cards.example_en: They traveled elsewhere for a unique vacation.

back_cards.definition_en: A public celebration with events or performances.
back_cards.example_en: The music festival attracted thousands of fans.

back_cards.definition_en: A cultural or religious holiday event.
back_cards.example_en: The town held a festival for the harvest season.

back_cards.definition_en: A gathering for a specific theme or art.
back_cards.example_en: The film festival showcased new directors.

back_cards.definition_en: A community event with food and activities.
back_cards.example_en: The spring festival had games and food stalls.

back_cards.definition_en: A large-scale organized celebration.
back_cards.example_en: The arts festival featured dance and theater.

back_cards.definition_en: A head covering, often for style or sport.
back_cards.example_en: He wore a baseball cap to the game.

back_cards.definition_en: A limit or maximum, as in spending.
back_cards.example_en: The city set a cap on water usage.

back_cards.definition_en: A top or cover for a container.
back_cards.example_en: She twisted the cap off the bottle.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbolic achievement or honor.
back_cards.example_en: Earning her degree was a cap to her hard work.

back_cards.definition_en: A small explosive device used in toys.
back_cards.example_en: The kids played with cap guns in the yard.

back_cards.definition_en: To make something safe or protected.
back_cards.example_en: They worked to secure the building against storms.

back_cards.definition_en: To obtain or acquire something.
back_cards.example_en: She managed to secure funding for the project.

back_cards.definition_en: To fasten or lock something in place.
back_cards.example_en: He secured the ladder before climbing.

back_cards.definition_en: To ensure or guarantee an outcome.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech secured her place in the debate.

back_cards.definition_en: To protect data or information.
back_cards.example_en: The app helps secure your personal information.

back_cards.definition_en: To fasten or join one thing to another.
back_cards.example_en: She attached a photo to the email.

back_cards.definition_en: To connect or associate with something.
back_cards.example_en: He attached great importance to punctuality.

back_cards.definition_en: To include or add as a supplement.
back_cards.example_en: Please attach your resume to the application.

back_cards.definition_en: To form an emotional bond.
back_cards.example_en: She quickly attached herself to the new team.

back_cards.definition_en: To fix or secure physically.
back_cards.example_en: They attached the shelf to the wall.

back_cards.definition_en: A system of parts working together in a machine.
back_cards.example_en: The clock’s mechanism ticked loudly.

back_cards.definition_en: A process or method for achieving something.
back_cards.example_en: The company has a mechanism for resolving disputes.

back_cards.definition_en: A natural or biological process.
back_cards.example_en: The body’s mechanism regulates temperature.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool or device in technical contexts.
back_cards.example_en: The engineer studied the mechanism of the engine.

back_cards.definition_en: A way of functioning in an organization.
back_cards.example_en: The voting mechanism ensured fair elections.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan or aim to do something.
back_cards.example_en: Her intention was to finish the book by Friday.

back_cards.definition_en: The purpose behind an action.
back_cards.example_en: His intention in calling was to apologize.

back_cards.definition_en: A goal in a professional setting.
back_cards.example_en: The team’s intention is to launch the product soon.

back_cards.definition_en: A deliberate motive in communication.
back_cards.example_en: She spoke with the intention of inspiring others.

back_cards.definition_en: A resolve to achieve something personal.
back_cards.example_en: His intention to exercise daily improved his health.

back_cards.definition_en: A possible situation or sequence of events.
back_cards.example_en: We prepared for a worst-case scenario during the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: A storyline or plot outline.
back_cards.example_en: The movie’s scenario was full of twists.

back_cards.definition_en: A hypothetical situation in planning.
back_cards.example_en: The team discussed a scenario for budget cuts.

back_cards.definition_en: A context for testing or simulation.
back_cards.example_en: The software tested a scenario for user errors.

back_cards.definition_en: An imagined outcome in daily life.
back_cards.example_en: She pictured a scenario where they met again.

back_cards.definition_en: To shout or speak loudly.
back_cards.example_en: He had to yell to be heard over the crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: To express excitement or urgency.
back_cards.example_en: She yelled with joy when her team won.

back_cards.definition_en: To call out in a noisy environment.
back_cards.example_en: The coach yelled instructions during the game.

back_cards.definition_en: To communicate across a distance.
back_cards.example_en: He yelled to his friend across the field.

back_cards.definition_en: To express anger or frustration.
back_cards.example_en: She yelled at the driver for cutting her off.

back_cards.definition_en: Extremely impressive or amazing.
back_cards.example_en: The view from the mountain was incredible.

back_cards.definition_en: Hard to believe or extraordinary.
back_cards.example_en: Her story of survival was incredible.

back_cards.definition_en: Remarkable in quality or skill.
back_cards.example_en: The chef created an incredible dessert.

back_cards.definition_en: Astonishing in scale or impact.
back_cards.example_en: The team made an incredible effort to finish.

back_cards.definition_en: Unbelievable in a positive context.
back_cards.example_en: He had an incredible talent for singing.

back_cards.definition_en: The language spoken in Spain and Latin America.
back_cards.example_en: She’s learning Spanish for her trip to Mexico.

back_cards.definition_en: A person from Spain.
back_cards.example_en: The Spanish welcomed us with warm hospitality.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to Spanish culture or traditions.
back_cards.example_en: They danced to Spanish music at the festival.

back_cards.definition_en: A citizen of Spain in a formal context.
back_cards.example_en: The Spanish voted in the national election.

back_cards.definition_en: Something associated with Spain’s history.
back_cards.example_en: The Spanish architecture in the city was stunning.

back_cards.definition_en: With great force or intensity.
back_cards.example_en: She strongly disagreed with the new policy.

back_cards.definition_en: In a firm or confident manner.
back_cards.example_en: He strongly defended his team’s decision.

back_cards.definition_en: With a high degree of certainty.
back_cards.example_en: I strongly believe we’ll succeed this time.

back_cards.definition_en: In a physically powerful way.
back_cards.example_en: The wind blew strongly across the valley.

back_cards.definition_en: With deep conviction or emphasis.
back_cards.example_en: She strongly supports environmental causes.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to race or ethnic groups.
back_cards.example_en: The discussion focused on racial equality in schools.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving differences based on race.
back_cards.example_en: The policy aimed to address racial disparities.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to cultural or social identity.
back_cards.example_en: The festival celebrated racial diversity.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to historical racial issues.
back_cards.example_en: The book explored racial tensions in the 1960s.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing attitudes or biases about race.
back_cards.example_en: They worked to overcome racial stereotypes.

back_cards.definition_en: The system of moving people or goods.
back_cards.example_en: Public transportation makes the city accessible.

back_cards.definition_en: A means of travel, like cars or trains.
back_cards.example_en: She uses a bike for transportation to work.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of shipping goods.
back_cards.example_en: The company handles transportation of fresh produce.

back_cards.definition_en: Infrastructure for moving vehicles.
back_cards.example_en: The city invested in transportation upgrades.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to get to an event or place.
back_cards.example_en: They arranged transportation for the wedding guests.

back_cards.definition_en: A container used for cooking.
back_cards.example_en: She boiled water in a pot for pasta.

back_cards.definition_en: A vessel for holding plants.
back_cards.example_en: The flowers grew beautifully in the clay pot.

back_cards.definition_en: A sum of money in a game or bet.
back_cards.example_en: He won the entire pot in the poker game.

back_cards.definition_en: A colloquial term for a large amount.
back_cards.example_en: They made a pot of money from the sale.

back_cards.definition_en: A receptacle for food or storage.
back_cards.example_en: She stored cookies in a ceramic pot.

back_cards.definition_en: A male romantic partner.
back_cards.example_en: Her boyfriend surprised her with flowers.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a close personal relationship.
back_cards.example_en: They’ve been boyfriends for two years now.

back_cards.definition_en: A companion for social events.
back_cards.example_en: She brought her boyfriend to the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone sharing emotional support.
back_cards.example_en: Her boyfriend listened to her after a tough day.

back_cards.definition_en: A partner in a casual or serious romance.
back_cards.example_en: He’s her boyfriend, and they love hiking together.

back_cards.definition_en: Careful thought or deliberation.
back_cards.example_en: After much consideration, she chose the job.

back_cards.definition_en: Respect or regard for others’ feelings.
back_cards.example_en: He showed consideration by lowering the music.

back_cards.definition_en: A factor in decision-making.
back_cards.example_en: Cost was a major consideration for the purchase.

back_cards.definition_en: Thoughtful attention in planning.
back_cards.example_en: The event required consideration of safety rules.

back_cards.definition_en: A kind or helpful act.
back_cards.example_en: Her help was a great consideration to the team.

back_cards.definition_en: Occurring before something else in time.
back_cards.example_en: She had no prior experience in coding.

back_cards.definition_en: Earlier or previous in sequence.
back_cards.example_en: The prior meeting set the project’s goals.

back_cards.definition_en: More important or taking precedence.
back_cards.example_en: Her prior commitment was to her family.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to past events or conditions.
back_cards.example_en: The prior agreement needed revision.

back_cards.definition_en: Before a specific event or deadline.
back_cards.example_en: Please submit the form prior to Friday.

back_cards.definition_en: The period after leaving one’s job or career.
back_cards.example_en: He traveled the world during his retirement.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of stopping work permanently.
back_cards.example_en: Her retirement was celebrated with a party.

back_cards.definition_en: Withdrawal from an activity or role.
back_cards.example_en: His retirement from sports surprised fans.

back_cards.definition_en: A phase of life for leisure or new pursuits.
back_cards.example_en: She took up painting in retirement.

back_cards.definition_en: Financial planning for post-work life.
back_cards.example_en: They saved carefully for a secure retirement.

back_cards.definition_en: Not often or infrequently.
back_cards.example_en: She rarely visits the city anymore.

back_cards.definition_en: Seldom occurring in daily life.
back_cards.example_en: He rarely eats out due to his busy schedule.

back_cards.definition_en: Hardly ever in a specific context.
back_cards.example_en: The team rarely loses at home games.

back_cards.definition_en: Occurring only in unusual cases.
back_cards.example_en: It rarely snows in this part of the state.

back_cards.definition_en: Almost never in regular situations.
back_cards.example_en: She rarely forgets her lines in a play.

back_cards.definition_en: A place where two parts connect or meet.
back_cards.example_en: The joint in the pipe needed repair.

back_cards.definition_en: A shared effort or collaboration.
back_cards.example_en: The project was a joint effort by both teams.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of the body where bones meet.
back_cards.example_en: His knee joint ached after the run.

back_cards.definition_en: A casual term for a place or establishment.
back_cards.example_en: We met at a burger joint downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for a rolled cigarette or similar item.
back_cards.example_en: They smoked a joint at the concert.

back_cards.definition_en: To keep something in its original state.
back_cards.example_en: They worked to preserve the ancient ruins.

back_cards.definition_en: To protect food by canning or pickling.
back_cards.example_en: She preserved the strawberries as jam.

back_cards.definition_en: To maintain or save for future use.
back_cards.example_en: He preserved his energy for the final race.

back_cards.definition_en: To safeguard traditions or culture.
back_cards.example_en: The festival helps preserve local customs.

back_cards.definition_en: To prevent harm or destruction.
back_cards.example_en: The team acted to preserve the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: Extremely large in size or amount.
back_cards.example_en: The elephant was enormous compared to the mouse.

back_cards.definition_en: Huge in terms of impact or importance.
back_cards.example_en: The discovery had an enormous effect on science.

back_cards.definition_en: Vast in scope or scale.
back_cards.example_en: The project required an enormous amount of time.

back_cards.definition_en: Overwhelming in quantity or degree.
back_cards.example_en: She felt enormous joy at the news.

back_cards.definition_en: Impressively big in a physical context.
back_cards.example_en: The enormous cake fed the entire party.

back_cards.definition_en: A rolled paper containing tobacco for smoking.
back_cards.example_en: He lit a cigarette on the porch.

back_cards.definition_en: An item associated with social settings.
back_cards.example_en: She offered him a cigarette at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A product in health-related discussions.
back_cards.example_en: The campaign warned about cigarette dangers.

back_cards.definition_en: A common habit in certain contexts.
back_cards.example_en: He quit cigarettes after ten years.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol in cultural or historical settings.
back_cards.example_en: Old movies often showed stars with cigarettes.

back_cards.definition_en: A building where goods are manufactured.
back_cards.example_en: The factory produces cars for export.

back_cards.definition_en: A place of mass production.
back_cards.example_en: Workers at the factory assembled electronics.

back_cards.definition_en: A site for industrial processes.
back_cards.example_en: The town’s economy relies on the factory.

back_cards.definition_en: A historical workplace in industry.
back_cards.example_en: The old factory was turned into a museum.

back_cards.definition_en: A facility for creating specific products.
back_cards.example_en: The chocolate factory offered free samples.

back_cards.definition_en: Worth a lot of money.
back_cards.example_en: The antique vase was very valuable.

back_cards.definition_en: Highly useful or important.
back_cards.example_en: Her advice was valuable during the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Precious in emotional or personal terms.
back_cards.example_en: The photo was valuable to her family.

back_cards.definition_en: Beneficial in a practical sense.
back_cards.example_en: His skills were valuable to the team.

back_cards.definition_en: Significant in impact or contribution.
back_cards.example_en: The research provided valuable insights.

back_cards.definition_en: A small device for holding things together.
back_cards.example_en: She used a clip to keep her papers organized.

back_cards.definition_en: A short segment of video or audio.
back_cards.example_en: The news showed a clip of the speech.

back_cards.definition_en: A fastener for hair or accessories.
back_cards.example_en: She wore a shiny clip in her hair.

back_cards.definition_en: A quick cut or trim, as in hair or plants.
back_cards.example_en: The barber gave him a quick clip.

back_cards.definition_en: A magazine or ammunition holder for a gun.
back_cards.example_en: He loaded the clip into the rifle.

back_cards.definition_en: Powered by electricity.
back_cards.example_en: The electric car was silent and fast.

back_cards.definition_en: Exciting or thrilling in atmosphere.
back_cards.example_en: The concert had an electric energy.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to electrical energy or devices.
back_cards.example_en: The electric heater warmed the room.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving electric currents or circuits.
back_cards.example_en: She studied electric systems in school.

back_cards.definition_en: Vibrant or intense in effect.
back_cards.example_en: His electric smile lit up the stage.

back_cards.definition_en: A very large person or thing in mythology.
back_cards.example_en: The story told of a giant who lived in the clouds.

back_cards.definition_en: A huge object or creature in nature.
back_cards.example_en: The giant redwood trees towered over the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A major company or organization.
back_cards.example_en: The tech giant released a new phone.

back_cards.definition_en: A person exceptional in ability or size.
back_cards.example_en: He was a giant in the world of science.

back_cards.definition_en: A massive structure or landmark.
back_cards.example_en: The giant statue greeted visitors to the city.

back_cards.definition_en: A person forced to work without freedom.
back_cards.example_en: The museum told stories of slaves in history.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone bound to involuntary servitude.
back_cards.example_en: The slave worked on the plantation long ago.

back_cards.definition_en: A person overly devoted to a task.
back_cards.example_en: He called himself a slave to his job.

back_cards.definition_en: A historical figure in oppressive systems.
back_cards.example_en: The book described a slave’s escape to freedom.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for extreme dedication.
back_cards.example_en: She was a slave to her art, always painting.

back_cards.definition_en: To present or hand in something formally.
back_cards.example_en: She submitted her essay before the deadline.

back_cards.definition_en: To yield or surrender to authority.
back_cards.example_en: He refused to submit to the new rules.

back_cards.definition_en: To offer for review or consideration.
back_cards.example_en: They submitted a proposal for funding.

back_cards.definition_en: To agree to follow a process or system.
back_cards.example_en: All teams must submit to the regulations.

back_cards.definition_en: To send in for publication or judgment.
back_cards.example_en: He submitted his novel to the publisher.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that produces results.
back_cards.example_en: She communicated effectively with her team.

back_cards.definition_en: With efficiency or success.
back_cards.example_en: The plan was executed effectively.

back_cards.definition_en: In a practical or impactful manner.
back_cards.example_en: He used the tool effectively to fix the issue.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that achieves a goal.
back_cards.example_en: The campaign effectively raised awareness.

back_cards.definition_en: With clear or successful outcomes.
back_cards.example_en: She taught the lesson effectively to the class.

back_cards.definition_en: To watch or observe something carefully.
back_cards.example_en: She monitored the experiment for changes.

back_cards.definition_en: To track progress or performance.
back_cards.example_en: The coach monitored the team’s training.

back_cards.definition_en: To check or oversee a system.
back_cards.example_en: They monitor the network for security issues.

back_cards.definition_en: To keep an eye on health or conditions.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor monitored her patient’s heart rate.

back_cards.definition_en: To supervise or review activities.
back_cards.example_en: He monitored the kids during the field trip.

back_cards.definition_en: To find a solution to a problem.
back_cards.example_en: They worked to resolve the conflict peacefully.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a firm decision.
back_cards.example_en: She resolved to exercise every morning.

back_cards.definition_en: To settle or clear up a dispute.
back_cards.example_en: The team resolved the issue with a meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: To determine or decide formally.
back_cards.example_en: The board resolved to approve the budget.

back_cards.definition_en: To address a challenge or obstacle.
back_cards.example_en: He resolved the technical glitch quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: Still present or left over.
back_cards.example_en: She ate the remaining slice of pizza.

back_cards.definition_en: Not yet used or dealt with.
back_cards.example_en: The remaining tasks were finished by noon.

back_cards.definition_en: Continuing to exist or stay.
back_cards.example_en: The remaining trees survived the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: Leftover after others are gone.
back_cards.example_en: The remaining guests stayed until midnight.

back_cards.definition_en: Yet to be completed or addressed.
back_cards.example_en: The remaining issues were discussed later.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of taking part in an activity.
back_cards.example_en: Her participation in the club was appreciated.

back_cards.definition_en: Involvement in a group or event.
back_cards.example_en: Participation in the vote was mandatory.

back_cards.definition_en: Engagement in a discussion or project.
back_cards.example_en: His participation added value to the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Joining in a community or social effort.
back_cards.example_en: Participation in the cleanup helped the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Active contribution to a cause.
back_cards.example_en: Their participation in the fundraiser was key.

back_cards.definition_en: A small, flowing body of water.
back_cards.example_en: The stream ran through the quiet forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A continuous flow of data or media.
back_cards.example_en: She watched a movie on a streaming service.

back_cards.definition_en: A steady sequence of events or items.
back_cards.example_en: A stream of cars passed by the house.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of students in a school system.
back_cards.example_en: He was in the advanced stream for math.

back_cards.definition_en: A flow of ideas or conversation.
back_cards.example_en: Her stream of thoughts inspired the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To remove or eliminate something unwanted.
back_cards.example_en: She worked to rid her closet of old clothes.

back_cards.definition_en: To free oneself from a burden.
back_cards.example_en: He wanted to rid himself of stress.

back_cards.definition_en: To clear away something undesirable.
back_cards.example_en: They rid the garden of weeds.

back_cards.definition_en: To get rid of something permanently.
back_cards.example_en: The city rid the park of litter.

back_cards.definition_en: To cleanse or purify an area.
back_cards.example_en: She rid the kitchen of ants with traps.

back_cards.definition_en: The point or place where something begins.
back_cards.example_en: The dish has its origin in Italian cuisine.

back_cards.definition_en: The source or cause of something.
back_cards.example_en: The origin of the rumor was unclear.

back_cards.definition_en: A person’s background or ancestry.
back_cards.example_en: She was proud of her Irish origin.

back_cards.definition_en: The starting point in a process.
back_cards.example_en: The origin of the project was a simple idea.

back_cards.definition_en: A historical or cultural beginning.
back_cards.example_en: The festival traces its origin to ancient times.

back_cards.definition_en: A person aged 13 to 19.
back_cards.example_en: The teen joined the school’s soccer team.

back_cards.definition_en: A young person in adolescence.
back_cards.example_en: The teen spent hours on her phone.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a teenage group or culture.
back_cards.example_en: The concert was packed with teens.

back_cards.definition_en: A student in high school years.
back_cards.example_en: The teen studied hard for her exams.

back_cards.definition_en: A young individual in social contexts.
back_cards.example_en: The teen organized a community event.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a legislative body like Congress.
back_cards.example_en: The congressional hearing was broadcast live.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving members of Congress.
back_cards.example_en: She met with a congressional leader.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to laws or policies made by Congress.
back_cards.example_en: The congressional budget was debated for weeks.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to government proceedings.
back_cards.example_en: The congressional report addressed healthcare.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing a district or election.
back_cards.example_en: He ran in the congressional race.

back_cards.definition_en: To tie or fasten something together.
back_cards.example_en: She used rope to bind the boxes.

back_cards.definition_en: To commit someone to an obligation.
back_cards.example_en: The contract will bind them to the agreement.

back_cards.definition_en: To unite people or things emotionally.
back_cards.example_en: Their shared goal helped bind the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To wrap or secure tightly.
back_cards.example_en: He bound the wound with a bandage.

back_cards.definition_en: To create a book by fastening pages.
back_cards.example_en: The shop can bind your manuscript into a book.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of outer clothing for warmth.
back_cards.example_en: She wore a heavy coat in the snow.

back_cards.definition_en: A layer of covering, like paint or fur.
back_cards.example_en: The wall needed a fresh coat of paint.

back_cards.definition_en: An animal’s fur or outer covering.
back_cards.example_en: The dog’s coat was shiny and soft.

back_cards.definition_en: A protective layer on an object.
back_cards.example_en: The candy had a chocolate coat.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal garment for professionals.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor wore a white lab coat.

back_cards.definition_en: A tall structure, often for observation.
back_cards.example_en: The tower offered a view of the city.

back_cards.definition_en: A building that stands out due to height.
back_cards.example_en: The office tower was the tallest downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: A structure for communication or signals.
back_cards.example_en: The radio tower broadcasted signals clearly.

back_cards.definition_en: A historical or defensive building.
back_cards.example_en: The castle’s tower was centuries old.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of strength or prominence.
back_cards.example_en: He was a tower in the business world.

back_cards.definition_en: A legal permit to do something.
back_cards.example_en: She got her driver’s license at 16.

back_cards.definition_en: Official permission for a profession.
back_cards.example_en: He earned a license to practice medicine.

back_cards.definition_en: A document for software or media use.
back_cards.example_en: The software required a valid license.

back_cards.definition_en: Authority to sell or distribute.
back_cards.example_en: The store had a license to sell alcohol.

back_cards.definition_en: Freedom or allowance in a context.
back_cards.example_en: The artist took creative license with the story.

back_cards.definition_en: A social media platform for short posts.
back_cards.example_en: She shared her thoughts on Twitter daily.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for news and updates.
back_cards.example_en: The event trended on Twitter for hours.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for public conversation.
back_cards.example_en: Politicians used Twitter to reach voters.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of trending topics.
back_cards.example_en: The hashtag spread quickly on Twitter.

back_cards.definition_en: A platform for personal expression.
back_cards.example_en: He posted his art on Twitter to gain fans.

back_cards.definition_en: To establish or enforce something officially.
back_cards.example_en: The city imposed a new tax on businesses.

back_cards.definition_en: To force something on others.
back_cards.example_en: She didn’t want to impose her views on them.

back_cards.definition_en: To place a burden or demand.
back_cards.example_en: The project imposed tight deadlines on the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To introduce rules or restrictions.
back_cards.example_en: They imposed a curfew during the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: To take advantage of hospitality.
back_cards.example_en: I don’t want to impose by staying too long.

back_cards.definition_en: Free from guilt or wrongdoing.
back_cards.example_en: The jury found him innocent of the charges.

back_cards.definition_en: Pure or without harmful intent.
back_cards.example_en: Her innocent smile charmed everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: Lacking experience or knowledge.
back_cards.example_en: He was innocent about the city’s dangers.

back_cards.definition_en: Not responsible for an event.
back_cards.example_en: She was innocent in the project’s failure.

back_cards.definition_en: Simple or naive in behavior.
back_cards.example_en: His innocent curiosity led to many questions.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of courses in an educational program.
back_cards.example_en: The school updated its curriculum for science.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan for teaching specific subjects.
back_cards.example_en: The curriculum included art and music.

back_cards.definition_en: A structured academic course outline.
back_cards.example_en: She designed a curriculum for language learners.

back_cards.definition_en: A guide for professional training.
back_cards.example_en: The training curriculum covered safety rules.

back_cards.definition_en: A framework for learning goals.
back_cards.example_en: The curriculum aimed to build critical thinking.

back_cards.definition_en: Letters or packages sent through a postal system.
back_cards.example_en: She checked the mail for her package.

back_cards.definition_en: Electronic messages sent via email.
back_cards.example_en: He sent an urgent mail to his boss.

back_cards.definition_en: A system for delivering correspondence.
back_cards.example_en: The mail arrives every morning at ten.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of sent or received messages.
back_cards.example_en: Her inbox was full of unread mail.

back_cards.definition_en: A historical term for postal services.
back_cards.example_en: The mail was once carried by horse.

back_cards.definition_en: A deep understanding of something.
back_cards.example_en: Her insight into the problem was helpful.

back_cards.definition_en: A sudden realization or perception.
back_cards.example_en: He gained insight during the discussion.

back_cards.definition_en: Valuable knowledge from experience.
back_cards.example_en: The book offered insight into local culture.

back_cards.definition_en: A clear perspective on a topic.
back_cards.example_en: Her insight guided the team’s strategy.

back_cards.definition_en: An intuitive grasp of a situation.
back_cards.example_en: His insight into human behavior was uncanny.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who examines or researches something.
back_cards.example_en: The investigator solved the mystery quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional in law enforcement.
back_cards.example_en: The police investigator interviewed witnesses.

back_cards.definition_en: A researcher in a scientific field.
back_cards.example_en: The investigator studied climate change effects.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone probing a specific issue.
back_cards.example_en: The investigator looked into the company’s finances.

back_cards.definition_en: A detective in a formal inquiry.
back_cards.example_en: The investigator gathered evidence for the case.

back_cards.definition_en: A microscopic organism causing illness.
back_cards.example_en: The virus spread quickly through the town.

back_cards.definition_en: A harmful computer program.
back_cards.example_en: Her laptop crashed due to a virus.

back_cards.definition_en: A contagious disease agent.
back_cards.example_en: Doctors warned about a new virus outbreak.

back_cards.definition_en: A rapidly spreading idea or trend.
back_cards.example_en: The video went viral, like a virus online.

back_cards.definition_en: A biological entity studied in science.
back_cards.example_en: The virus was analyzed in the lab.

back_cards.definition_en: A powerful tropical storm with strong winds.
back_cards.example_en: The hurricane caused flooding along the coast.

back_cards.definition_en: A natural disaster with heavy rain.
back_cards.example_en: Residents evacuated before the hurricane hit.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for intense or chaotic events.
back_cards.example_en: The news created a hurricane of controversy.

back_cards.definition_en: A weather event tracked by meteorologists.
back_cards.example_en: The hurricane was monitored by satellite.

back_cards.definition_en: A destructive force in nature.
back_cards.example_en: The hurricane damaged homes and trees.

back_cards.definition_en: Correct or precise in detail.
back_cards.example_en: Her report was accurate and well-researched.

back_cards.definition_en: Free from errors or mistakes.
back_cards.example_en: The clock was accurate to the second.

back_cards.definition_en: Reliable in measurements or data.
back_cards.example_en: The weather forecast was surprisingly accurate.

back_cards.definition_en: Truthful in describing something.
back_cards.example_en: His account of the event was accurate.

back_cards.definition_en: Exact in performance or execution.
back_cards.example_en: The archer’s aim was accurate every time.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of providing or supplying something.
back_cards.example_en: The provision of food helped the community.

back_cards.definition_en: A clause or condition in an agreement.
back_cards.example_en: The contract included a provision for delays.

back_cards.definition_en: Resources prepared for future use.
back_cards.example_en: They stored provisions for the winter.

back_cards.definition_en: A rule or term in legal documents.
back_cards.example_en: The law’s provision protected workers’ rights.

back_cards.definition_en: Supplies for a specific purpose.
back_cards.example_en: The camp had provisions for a week.

back_cards.definition_en: To share or exchange information.
back_cards.example_en: She communicated her ideas clearly in the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: To talk or interact with others.
back_cards.example_en: He loves to communicate with his friends online.

back_cards.definition_en: To convey feelings or emotions.
back_cards.example_en: Her smile communicated joy to everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: To transmit data or signals.
back_cards.example_en: The device communicates with the server.

back_cards.definition_en: To connect through language or signs.
back_cards.example_en: They communicated using sign language.

back_cards.definition_en: To differ or change in some way.
back_cards.example_en: The weather can vary greatly in spring.

back_cards.definition_en: To be different across a group.
back_cards.example_en: Opinions on the topic vary among students.

back_cards.definition_en: To alter or modify something.
back_cards.example_en: She varied her workout routine weekly.

back_cards.definition_en: To show diversity in characteristics.
back_cards.example_en: The flowers vary in color and size.

back_cards.definition_en: To fluctuate in amount or degree.
back_cards.example_en: Prices vary depending on the season.

back_cards.definition_en: A short coat for casual or outdoor wear.
back_cards.example_en: He wore a warm jacket in the cold.

back_cards.definition_en: A protective outer layer for objects.
back_cards.example_en: The book’s jacket had a colorful design.

back_cards.definition_en: A garment for professional settings.
back_cards.example_en: She paired her jacket with a formal skirt.

back_cards.definition_en: A covering for food or items.
back_cards.example_en: The potato was cooked in its jacket.

back_cards.definition_en: A stylish piece of clothing.
back_cards.example_en: His leather jacket was perfect for the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Growing in amount or size.
back_cards.example_en: The increasing demand led to higher prices.

back_cards.definition_en: Rising in frequency or intensity.
back_cards.example_en: Her increasing confidence showed in her speech.

back_cards.definition_en: Expanding over time.
back_cards.example_en: The company saw increasing sales this year.

back_cards.definition_en: Becoming more common or frequent.
back_cards.example_en: Increasing traffic caused delays in the city.

back_cards.definition_en: Gradually getting larger or stronger.
back_cards.example_en: The storm’s increasing winds were dangerous.

back_cards.definition_en: In the same way or to the same degree.
back_cards.example_en: The prizes were divided equally among the winners.

back_cards.definition_en: With fairness or impartiality.
back_cards.example_en: She treated all her students equally.

back_cards.definition_en: To an identical extent or amount.
back_cards.example_en: Both teams were equally skilled in the match.

back_cards.definition_en: In a balanced or similar manner.
back_cards.example_en: The tasks were equally challenging for all.

back_cards.definition_en: With equal importance or value.
back_cards.example_en: All opinions were valued equally in the discussion.

back_cards.definition_en: A possible effect or consequence.
back_cards.example_en: The decision had implications for the budget.

back_cards.definition_en: Something suggested but not directly stated.
back_cards.example_en: His tone carried an implication of doubt.

back_cards.definition_en: A logical outcome of an action.
back_cards.example_en: The policy’s implications were debated heavily.

back_cards.definition_en: A hidden meaning in communication.
back_cards.example_en: Her words had implications she didn’t intend.

back_cards.definition_en: A result affecting future plans.
back_cards.example_en: The change had implications for the project timeline.

back_cards.definition_en: Literature that is imagined or invented.
back_cards.example_en: She loves reading fiction novels on weekends.

back_cards.definition_en: Stories that are not based on reality.
back_cards.example_en: The movie was a work of science fiction.

back_cards.definition_en: A genre of creative writing.
back_cards.example_en: He wrote fiction inspired by his travels.

back_cards.definition_en: Something made up or not true.
back_cards.example_en: The rumor was pure fiction, not fact.

back_cards.definition_en: A narrative for entertainment.
back_cards.example_en: Her fiction captivated readers worldwide.

back_cards.definition_en: A public demonstration against something.
back_cards.example_en: The protest marched through the city streets.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of objection or disapproval.
back_cards.example_en: She voiced her protest against the new rule.

back_cards.definition_en: A gathering for a cause or issue.
back_cards.example_en: The protest demanded better working conditions.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal complaint or opposition.
back_cards.example_en: They filed a protest with the government.

back_cards.definition_en: A collective action for change.
back_cards.example_en: The environmental protest drew thousands.

back_cards.definition_en: An affectionate term for a mother.
back_cards.example_en: The child called out for mama when scared.

back_cards.definition_en: A casual or familiar way to say mom.
back_cards.example_en: Mama baked cookies for the school event.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of endearment in family settings.
back_cards.example_en: She hugged her mama tightly after the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: A cultural reference to a mother figure.
back_cards.example_en: The song celebrated the love of a mama.

back_cards.definition_en: A nickname for a nurturing person.
back_cards.example_en: Everyone called her mama for her kindness.

back_cards.definition_en: To suggest something without directly saying it.
back_cards.example_en: Her smile implied she was happy with the news.

back_cards.definition_en: To hint at a meaning or idea.
back_cards.example_en: His words implied a need for change.

back_cards.definition_en: To indicate indirectly in conversation.
back_cards.example_en: She implied they should leave early.

back_cards.definition_en: To suggest a consequence or outcome.
back_cards.example_en: The data implied a rise in sales.

back_cards.definition_en: To convey subtly in writing or speech.
back_cards.example_en: The story implied a deeper moral lesson.

back_cards.definition_en: One of two children born together.
back_cards.example_en: The twin looked just like her sister.

back_cards.definition_en: A pair of similar or identical things.
back_cards.example_en: The buildings were twin towers in the city.

back_cards.definition_en: A person very similar to another.
back_cards.example_en: He’s my twin in taste for music.

back_cards.definition_en: A matching or corresponding item.
back_cards.example_en: The lamps were a twin set for the room.

back_cards.definition_en: A sibling sharing the same birthday.
back_cards.example_en: The twins celebrated their tenth birthday.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of clothing, typically trousers.
back_cards.example_en: She wore black pants to the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: A garment for casual or formal wear.
back_cards.example_en: His new pants were perfect for hiking.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for breathing heavily (as a verb).
back_cards.example_en: The dog began to pant after running.

back_cards.definition_en: A style of clothing in fashion.
back_cards.example_en: The store sold trendy pants for teens.

back_cards.definition_en: A plural term for legwear.
back_cards.example_en: She packed two pairs of pants for the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: To curve or shape something by force.
back_cards.example_en: He bent the wire into a circle.

back_cards.definition_en: To lean or tilt the body.
back_cards.example_en: She bent down to tie her shoe.

back_cards.definition_en: To change direction, as in a road.
back_cards.example_en: The path bent sharply to the left.

back_cards.definition_en: To adapt or yield under pressure.
back_cards.example_en: He bent to the team’s new schedule.

back_cards.definition_en: To fold or flex something.
back_cards.example_en: She bent the paper to make an origami crane.

back_cards.definition_en: A sudden or surprising event.
back_cards.example_en: The news of the accident was a shock.

back_cards.definition_en: An emotional or physical jolt.
back_cards.example_en: The cold water gave her a shock.

back_cards.definition_en: A medical condition from trauma.
back_cards.example_en: The patient was treated for shock.

back_cards.definition_en: An unexpected outcome or result.
back_cards.example_en: Her victory was a shock to the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A sudden disruption or disturbance.
back_cards.example_en: The power surge caused a shock to the system.

back_cards.definition_en: Standards for judgment or evaluation.
back_cards.example_en: The criteria for the job were strict.

back_cards.definition_en: Rules or guidelines for decisions.
back_cards.example_en: She met all the criteria for the scholarship.

back_cards.definition_en: Conditions to assess performance.
back_cards.example_en: The criteria helped judge the competition.

back_cards.definition_en: Requirements for a process or selection.
back_cards.example_en: The team set criteria for new members.

back_cards.definition_en: Benchmarks for success or quality.
back_cards.example_en: The project’s criteria ensured high standards.

back_cards.definition_en: A person from an Arabic-speaking region.
back_cards.example_en: The Arab shared stories of his desert home.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to Arab culture or heritage.
back_cards.example_en: She enjoyed Arab music at the festival.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of an ethnic or cultural group.
back_cards.example_en: The Arab community hosted a cultural event.

back_cards.definition_en: A citizen of an Arab country.
back_cards.example_en: The Arab voted in the national election.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone tied to Arab history or traditions.
back_cards.example_en: The Arab poet recited ancient verses.

back_cards.exampleEn: His shoes were dirty after the hike.

back_cards.definitionEn: Unclean or impure in a moral sense.
back_cards.exampleEn: They played a dirty trick on their friend.
The kitchen was dirty after cooking dinner.
The team used dirty tactics to win.

back_cards.definitionEn: Referring to crude or inappropriate content.
back_cards.exampleEn: He told a dirty joke at the party.

back_cards.definitionEn: An object for children to play with.
back_cards.exampleEn: The child hugged her favorite toy bear.
He bought a toy car for his collection.
The drone was a fun toy for adults.
The puzzle was a great toy for the trip.
The toy soldier was part of a set.
This could potentially solve the issue.
She’s potentially the best candidate.
The storm could potentially cause delays.
The idea is potentially groundbreaking.
This move could potentially save money.
The assault was reported to the police.

back_cards.definitionEn: A strong verbal or emotional attack.
back_cards.exampleEn: Her speech was an assault on bad policies.
The army planned an assault at dawn.
The media faced an assault of questions.

back_cards.definitionEn: A legal term for an aggressive act.
back_cards.exampleEn: He was charged with assault after the fight.

back_cards.definitionEn: The highest point of a mountain.
back_cards.exampleEn: They reached the peak after a long climb.

back_cards.definitionEn: The top or maximum of something.
back_cards.exampleEn: She was at the peak of her career.

back_cards.definitionEn: A high point in activity or success.
back_cards.exampleEn: Sales hit their peak during the holidays.

back_cards.definitionEn: The pointed top of an object.
back_cards.exampleEn: The roof’s peak was covered in snow.
The storm reached its peak at midnight.
His anger was clear after the argument.
She felt anger when her idea was ignored.
The decision sparked anger among workers.
He expressed his anger through loud words.

back_cards.definitionEn: A state of being upset or irritated.
back_cards.exampleEn: Her anger faded after a calm talk.

back_cards.definitionEn: A sturdy shoe covering the ankle.
back_cards.exampleEn: She wore boots to hike in the mud.

back_cards.definitionEn: A protective covering for a vehicle part.
back_cards.exampleEn: The mechanic checked the car’s boot.

back_cards.definitionEn: A kick or act of kicking.
back_cards.exampleEn: He gave the ball a hard boot.

back_cards.definitionEn: A compartment in a car (British usage).
back_cards.exampleEn: She put her bags in the car’s boot.
He got the boot from his job.
The sunset was a dramatic display of colors.
She gave a dramatic performance in the play.
The policy caused a dramatic change in sales.
His dramatic reaction surprised everyone.
The dress had a dramatic flair.

back_cards.definitionEn: A person of the same age or status.
back_cards.exampleEn: She discussed the project with her peers.

back_cards.definitionEn: Someone in a similar social group.
back_cards.exampleEn: His peers admired his leadership skills.

back_cards.definitionEn: A colleague in a professional setting.
back_cards.exampleEn: The scientist shared findings with peers.

back_cards.definitionEn: A member of a peer group in school.
back_cards.exampleEn: The teen felt pressure from her peers.

back_cards.definitionEn: An equal in a community or team.
back_cards.exampleEn: He was respected among his peers.
She used spices to enhance the dish’s flavor.
The app enhances the user experience.
Training will enhance your skills.

back_cards.definitionEn: To make more attractive or appealing.
back_cards.exampleEn: The lighting enhanced the room’s beauty.
The update enhanced the software’s speed.

back_cards.definitionEn: The study of numbers and shapes.
back_cards.exampleEn: She excelled in math during school.
Math is required for engineering courses.

back_cards.definitionEn: A field of logic and problem-solving.
back_cards.exampleEn: He used math to solve the puzzle.
The math behind the survey was complex.
Math was her favorite class this year.
